service.name: Rural Locum Education Assistance Programme
service.description:
The Rural Locum Education Assistance Program (Rural LEAP) provides financial assistance to eligible urban general practitioners (GPs) who complete emergency medicine training and commit to a total of four weeks (20 working days) general practice locum placement in a rural or remote area within a two year period. This is a one off incentive which gives participants financial assistance up to a total of $6,000 to undertake emergency medicine training.
The department maintains a register of eligible GPs and makes payments to GPs when theyve completed their first 10 working days of the locum commitment. Human Services also tracks the two year period for participants to undertake their locum commitment.
